alert.note: Alert for Perry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 5:48PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Perry County through 645 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Thornport, or 7 miles northwest of Somerset, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Somerset, Perry State Forest, Thornport, Harbor Hills, Thornville and Glenford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
